title: The Call of Abram
summary: Genesis 12 marks the beginning of God’s covenant relationship with Abram, promising to make him a great nation. Abram obeys and travels to Canaan, though he briefly detours to Egypt.

faq.question: What did God promise Abram?
faq.answer: That He would make Abram a great nation, bless him, and bless all nations through him.

faq.question: Why did Abram go to Egypt?
faq.answer: A famine struck the land, so Abram went to Egypt for food and safety.

faq.question: Why did Abram build altars?
faq.answer: People built altars to worship God and mark special places where He had spoken to them or helped them. It was their way of showing thanks and remembering God’s promises.

faq.question: Why did Abram say Sarai was his sister in Egypt?
faq.answer: Abram was afraid that the Egyptians might hurt him to take his wife, so he told a half-truth. In that culture, powerful rulers often took beautiful women into their homes. Abram's fear shows he didn’t fully trust God to protect him yet.
